III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was involved in a disagreement with another youth at the
facility regarding Legos. Staff member responded by dragging one
youth back to their room. Staff member allowed the other youth to
enter the room and physically assault youth. Staff member also
kicked this youth in the legs. Staff member pinned youth's arms
and legs together and held youth in this position for 5 to 7
minutes. Youth has marks on the neck, an abrasion on the elbow,
and a sore body. Youth left the facility, wandered around, was
lost, and law enforcement had to be contacted.
Investigation This complaint was received on 10/11/2023 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
I contacted MDHHS Specialist on 10/11/2023 and was informed
MDHHS Specialist had just finished interviewing Youth A and was
getting ready to leave the facility.
I interviewed Director on 10/11/2023 at the facility. Director
reported on 10/10/2023 Youth A was involved in a verbal
argument with two other residents and Youth A started to curse
and used the “N” word. Staff intervened and attempted to redirect
the youths. Youth A got more escalated, went to his room, kicked,
and broke his desk, then ran out of the cottage. Staff attempted to
follow and redirect Youth A, but he refused to listen and ran off
campus. A police report was filed, Youth A was found two hours
later at a gas station; police notified staff and Youth A was picked
by staff. Director said Youth A didn’t report being hurt or having
any injury. Director reported Youth A will be examined by the
nurse. Video cameras are in the process of being installed,
therefore there was no video footage of the incident.
I interviewed Youth A on 10/11/2023 at the facility. Youth A is 12
years old and placed at Harrison Cottage. Youth A reported on
10/10/2023 he got into a fight with Youth B. He said Staff 1 held
2

him on the floor and Youth B kicked him in the head. He denied
being injured or hurt. He AWOLed after the fight, went to a gas
station, and the police found him. He said there were two staff
members in the cottage. Youth A initially said Youth B kicked him
in the head, but then he said Staff 1 kicked him while he was
laying on the floor in his bedroom. Youth A was asked what do the
staff do when he the youths fight and he responded staff separate
them and send them to their rooms to calm down.
I interviewed the complainant via telephone on 10/12/2023. They
reported they didn’t observe any bruise on Youth A. They said
Youth A kept saying he does not want to live at the facility.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker (FCW) via telephone on
10/12/2023. FCW reported she met with Youth A on 10/11/2023
and Youth A didn’t express any concerns regarding staff. She said
Youth A was recently diagnosed as autistic and will be meeting
with her supervisor to discuss finding Youth A another placement
due to his diagnosis and concerns for AWOLing.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 10/17/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a youth specialist, has been
working at the facility for 5 months, and completed CPI training in
May. Staff 1 denied touching or physically managing Youth A. He
reported on 10/10/2023 Youth A and Youth B were in the TV
room, and he was in the dining area. Youth A and Youth B started
to argue, Youth A attempted to hit Youth B, so he positioned
himself between the two boys. Youth A got more escalated and
called Youth B the “N” word. He tried to verbally redirect Youth A,
but Youth A got more upset, Youth A went to his bedroom, laid on
the floor under his desk, and started kicking the desk until he
broke the legs. He and Staff 2 went in the room, removed the
broken desk from the bedroom and that’s when Youth A ran out of
the cottage. He followed Youth A on foot until Youth A got to Six
Mile, so he went and got the facility van and attempted to find
Youth A. When he could not locate Youth A Staff 1 called the
police and filed a missing person report. He denied Youth B
punched or kicked Youth A. He again denied physically managing
or holding Youth A ‘s hands and feet. He said Youth A is easily
triggered and gets escalated when he does not get his way, but
staff do not use any form of physical management with Youth A
because he is easily triggered.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 10/01/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a youth specialist and has been
working at the facility for 2 months. He completed all new hire
3

training including CPI. He recalled the incident on 10/10/2023 and
reported Youth A and Youth B were arguing so Staff 1 separated
the two youths by standing between them. He said Youth A was
calling Youth B the “N” word. He denied witnessing Youth B
kicking or hitting Youth A. He said Youth A got more escalated
when Staff 1 verbally redirected him and ran to his room. Youth A
started breaking things in his room, so he and Staff 1 went in the
room and removed the broken desk. Youth A ran out of the
cottage. Staff 1 followed Youth A on foot and when he lost sight of
Youth A Staff 1 called the police and filed a missing person report.
He said Youth B didn’t go into Youth A’s room and staff would
never allow the youths to hurt each other. He further said Staff 1
did not physically manage or attempt to touch Youth A during the
incident.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the facility on 10/17/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 is a shift leader and has been
working at the facility for one year. Staff 3 witnessed Youth A and
Youth B arguing and fighting, so Staff 1 stepped between the two
boys. Staff 1 used verbal de-escalation and told the two youths to
go to their rooms. Youth A went to his room and started breaking
his desk. Staff 1 went in and was removing items to prevent Youth
A from hurting himself. She denied witnessing Staff holding Youth
A's hands and feet or physically managing Youth A. After the
incident Youth A AWOLed off campus, Staff 1 followed him, and
filed a police report. The police found Youth A at a gas station,
and she’s the one that picked up Youth A. She spoke with Youth A
and he didn’t report being injured or hurt.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 10/17/2023, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B reported on the day in question,
he and Youth A were arguing, and Youth A called him the “N”
word, so he swung at Youth A and Youth A swung at him. He said
Staff 1 intervened and told both youths to go to their rooms. Youth
B said they are not allowed to go into the other youth’s bedroom,
and he denied kicking Youth A. He said he heard Youth A
breaking things in his room and saw Youth A run out of the
cottage. Youth A denied witnessing staff hold Youth A’s hands
and feet. Youth A reported feeling safe and did not express any
concerns regarding staff.
A predisposition conference held with MDHHS Specialist on
11/09/2023. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist.
4

Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 10/10/2023 completed by Staff 1.
Report noted Youth A was cursing at Youth B and calling
him “black niggers.” Youth A was redirected by staff not to
use that language. Youth A got more escalated, he
attempted to kick and spit on staff. Youth A ran to his room
laid on the floor under his desk and kicked the desk until he
broke the desk. Youth A then ran out of the cottage. Staff 1
followed Youth A to Six Mile until he lost sight of him. Staff
1 called police and filed a police report. Two hours later
Livonia Police found Youth A at a gas station. Staff 3 went
and picked up Youth A from the gas station.
• Medical assessment for Youth A, dated 10/12/2023,
completed by Nurse. Youth A was examined by Nurse on
10/12//2023, no injuries or bruises noted. Youth denied
being involved in a fight or hurt by staff.
• Personnel file for Staff 1 -no disciplinary action.
• Facility’s AWOL policy. Staff are expected to make all efforts
to maintain eyesight of the youth(s). If youths leave the
grounds, staff should get a van and follow them. If youths
AWOL but stay on campus and go into the woods, staff
should contact the supervisor, follow calmly on foot, and
verbally attempt to return them. Staff must follow youths as far
as possible without endangering their own safety. If youths
retreat further into the woods and staff lose eyesight of them,
the police should be contacted, and a missing persons reports
filed.
• Youth A AWOLed on 10/10/2023; Police report #230022403.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentations reviewed,
there is insufficient evidence to support the allegations staff
dragged youth to his room, allowed another youth to assault him,
and pinned youth’s arms and legs down. Youth A was examined
by the nurse and no injuries or bruises noted.
Youth A had AWOLed on 10/10/2023 and documentation and staff
interviews confirmed staff followed facility’s policy regarding Youth
A AWOLing. Staff followed Youth A on foot, and when they lost
sight a police report was filed. Two hours later the Police found
Youth A at a gas station and staff picked up Youth A without
further incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
